channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report X-2023110790
item.description:
Report X-2023110790

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: NORTH BILLERICA
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM TRAILER. WHEN DISCOVERED BOTTOM OF BOX WAS WET WITH SUBSTANCE. WHEN OPENED FOUND BOTTLE WITH PLASTIC BAG WRAPPED AROUND IT. THERE WAS LIQUID INSIDE BAG. LEAKAGE COMING FROM UNDER CAP. CAP ITSELF WAS TIGHT BUT STILL LEAKING. PLACED IN A RED HAZMAT BIN AND PLACED IN QA. DescribePack: LEAKAGE FROM UNDER CAP. BLUE SEAL UNDER CAP LEAKING LIQUID DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED UPRIGHT IN A HAZMAT BIN

item.title: Report X-2023110737
item.description:
Report X-2023110737

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: MIDDLEBORO
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was found in the belly of trailer 824814 from Hartford during the preload. QA was notified and examined the package. The release from the hazmat was self contained and only affected the packaging of the hazmat itself. No release entered the trailer or contaminated other packages. The hazmat package was then removed from the trailer and brought to QA repack for processing. DescribePack: The cap on one of the bottles was loose causing roughly 2oz of the liquid to spill inside of the box. The face of the box closest to the spill became wet and ripped from the damage. It also became stained. The rip was at the top left of the face of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was removed and kept away from other boxes to prevent any potential additional spillage from causing damage. After DPR was processed caps were tightened on all bottles to prevent further spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023111063
item.description:
Report X-2023111063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: PITTSFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE DELIVERED BY UPS ACCIDENTALY TO USPS. USPS TENDERED PACKAGE BACK TO UPS, HAD A BAD ZIP CODE, UPON LOOKING FOR AN INVOICE TO IDENTIFY RECIEVER ADDRESS, CLERK FOUND THE CONTENTS TO BE HAZARDOUS AND SHOULD HAVE BEEN A REGULATED GOOD. PROCESSING AS UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023110453
item.description:
Report X-2023110453

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-11
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE SOUTH SORT AISLE. RESPONDER NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE CORNERS OF THE OUTER PACKAGING. DONED HIS P.P.E. HE THEN, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUBE. THE AREA WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. HE THEN BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023110419
item.description:
Report X-2023110419

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: SOMERVILLE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY EIGHT POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING CLINICAL NUTRITION VIAL SAMPLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX HAS PERISHABLE, THIS SIDE UP, AND RUSH PREPRINTED ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 8767X8, SENSORY CLOUD, INC., 50 MILK ST., BOSTON MA 02110.
